summary: This is an email chain from August 15-16, 2019, discussing legal strategy regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. It includes coordination on drafting a nolle prosequi (notice not to prosecute) filing and mentions awaiting a medical examiner's report. The email also references an Avenatti motion to dismiss and discovery request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email discusses the timing and drafting of a nolle prosequi filing related to his case.

persons.name: Avenatti
persons.context: The email requests to see the 'Avenatti MTD' (Motion to Dismiss) and references an attached legal memorandum from him.

connections.description: Avenatti is involved in legal proceedings (filing a motion to dismiss and for discovery) that are being discussed in the context of the Epstein case.

events.title: Email coordination on legal filings
events.description: Email exchange discussing the drafting of a nolle prosequi for the Epstein case and reviewing an Avenatti motion to dismiss.

events.title: Anticipation of Medical Examiner report
events.description: Email states hope to receive the ME (Medical Examiner) report later that day or on Monday, August 19, 2019.

keyFacts: Legal team was actively drafting a nolle prosequi (notice not to prosecute) in the Jeffrey Epstein case in mid-August 2019.
The team was awaiting a Medical Examiner's report, expected around August 16-19, 2019.
Attorney Michael Avenatti was involved in the broader legal proceedings, with a motion to dismiss and for discovery being circulated.
The email chain shows coordination between legal team members on the timing and content of these filings.
